intro: Banksia dactyloides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf banksia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to the south-western region of Western Australia, where it grows in sandy soils and heathlands. The plant is characterized by its long, narrow leaves and its distinctive cylindrical flower spikes. It produces yellow flowers that are visited by a variety of native bees and birds. Banksia dactyloides is also known for its hard, woody seed pods that release seeds after a fire, aiding in its regeneration.
